channel.title: Help Portforwarding With TrendNet Wireless Router
channel.description: So I have TrendNet wireless router, but all the portforwarding guides are for linkseys, I tried, but I cant figure out how to do it on my own. Can anyone help?

item.title: Help Portforwarding With TrendNet Wireless Router
item.dc:creator: @Systemerror Systemerror
item.description:
@Systemerror wrote:

Have you tried going to your Router homepage? It is usually 192.168.1.1. Go there, find a link that says something like ‘Port Forwarding’ Or “Firewall”. I have 2Wire and mine is under Firewall. Just find that link, it shouldnt be to hard, when you find it, open up port 43594 UPD/TCP. The UDP/TCP is to allow connections from and to your router. If that port is not open, it will block any connection to you. Now… if this still does not work, still open the ports but turn off your router for 5 mins. This resets it, and allows the ports you just opened to fully open.

My router does the same thing, it says it is open but its not, it just needs a little nudge some times = - ].

I hope this helps

Read full topic
item.source: Help Portforwarding With TrendNet Wireless Router
